result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leopoldo Balderas III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leopoldo Balderas III in court.  Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court for Leopoldo Balderas III.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Feiss.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Hanrahan, Br. 4. Defense requests additional time for review. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated September 27, 2022; received and filed.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated September 27, 2022; received and filed.

Defense contacted Court to request removal of bail hearing on 9-22-2022 8:30 am due to defendant posting bail. Court granted request and removes hearing on 9-22-2022. Parties advised next court date on 9-28-2022 8:30 am in Branch 4.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Feiss.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Hanrahan, Br. 04.

Defendant Leopoldo Balderas III appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court in person for Leopoldo Balderas III.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #98CF3209. Sworn for the State: Detective T. Mason. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court, appear by video. Defendant Leopoldo Balderas not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness tested postive for COVID fail to appear.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 073902,
Payable Number: 1023906,
Receipt Number: 22RP031171,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with D.L.A; L.L.J;S.E.M.; M.M.R-H and M.L.S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Leopoldo Balderas in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Leopoldo Balderas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
